intro: Calochortus citrinus, commonly known as the yellow mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This species is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals and a distinctive, showy flower that blooms in late spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
